question: Medicaid (Medical Assistance)
text:
Medicaid (Medical Assistance) 
          
        
Medicaid, or 
Medicaid Assistance
 as it is commonly known in Pennsylvania, is a health program that provides health coverage at no-cost to people with disabilities, the elderly, pregnant women, children and families, as well as childless adults, whos household income is below a certain threshold, and who meet other eligibility requirements. Pennsylvania has expanded its Medicaid program to ensure that Pennsylvanians with income below 138% of the federal poverty level have access to Medicaid, if they otherwise qualify.
You can apply for Medicaid anytime throughout the year through the Department of Human Services 
COMPASS
 application. If you qualify, your coverage can begin immediately, any time of year.
